tests.query:
--
-- CREATE_MISC
--

--
-- a is the type root
-- b and c inherit from a (one-level single inheritance)
-- d inherits from b and c (two-level multiple inheritance)
-- e inherits from c (two-level single inheritance)
-- f inherits from e (three-level single inheritance)
--
CREATE TABLE a_star (
	class		char,
	a 			int4
)
tests.name: create_misc.sql
create_misc.sql
create_misc.sql
create_misc.sql
create_misc.sql
create_misc.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO a_star (class, a) VALUES ('a', 1)
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO a_star (class, a) VALUES ('a', 2)
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO a_star (class) VALUES ('a')
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO b_star (class) VALUES ('b')
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
-- Analyze the X_star tables for better plan stability in later tests
ANALYZE a_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE b_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE c_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE d_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE e_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE f_star
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
--
-- inheritance stress test
--
SELECT * FROM a_star*
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT *
   FROM b_star* x
   WHERE x.b = text 'bumble' or x.a < 3
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT class, a
   FROM c_star* x
   WHERE x.c ~ text 'hi'
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT class, b, c
   FROM d_star* x
   WHERE x.a < 100
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: SELECT class, c FROM e_star* x WHERE x.c NOTNULL
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: SELECT * FROM f_star* x WHERE x.c ISNULL
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
-- grouping and aggregation on inherited sets have been busted in the past...

SELECT sum(a) FROM a_star*
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: SELECT class, sum(a) FROM a_star* GROUP BY class ORDER BY class
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE f_star RENAME COLUMN f TO ff
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE e_star* RENAME COLUMN e TO ee
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE d_star* RENAME COLUMN d TO dd
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE c_star* RENAME COLUMN c TO cc
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE b_star* RENAME COLUMN b TO bb
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE a_star* RENAME COLUMN a TO aa
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT class, aa
   FROM a_star* x
   WHERE aa ISNULL
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
-- As of Postgres 7.1, ALTER implicitly recurses,
-- so this should be same as ALTER a_star*

ALTER TABLE a_star RENAME COLUMN aa TO foo
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT class, foo
   FROM a_star* x
   WHERE x.foo >= 2
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE a_star RENAME COLUMN foo TO aa
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
SELECT *
   from a_star*
   WHERE aa < 1000
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE f_star ADD COLUMN f int4
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: UPDATE f_star SET f = 10
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE e_star* ADD COLUMN e int4
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: --UPDATE e_star* SET e = 42
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: SELECT * FROM e_star*
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: ALTER TABLE a_star* ADD COLUMN a text
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
-- That ALTER TABLE should have added TOAST tables.
SELECT relname, reltoastrelid <> 0 AS has_toast_table
   FROM pg_class
   WHERE oid::regclass IN ('a_star', 'c_star')
   ORDER BY 1
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query:
--UPDATE b_star*
--   SET a = text 'gazpacho'
--   WHERE aa > 4
tests.name: create_misc.sql

tests.query: SELECT class, aa, a FROM a_star*
tests.name: create_misc.sql
